text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with a shrimp cocktail the classic
american appetizer and surprisingly more
complicated to make than you think
but totally worth it so we're going to
start by making what's called a court
bouillon which is just a fancy French
culinary term for a flavorful poaching
liquid so I have water cold water some
onions some garlic lemon a bay leaf
peppercorns some tarragon sprigs some
old bay don't even think I use a new bay
some old bay and some salt put that over
high heat give it a stir
bring it up to a simmer and I like to
simmer that at least 15 20 minutes so
all the flavors meld and you're going to
have a great great quart blue by the way
Korb Lyon comes from the days when the
kings and queens had the court and there
was the court jester and the court
scribe and the court bleona was the
person that made all the king's stocks
and broths alright so while our poaching
liquid is cooking we're going to make
our cocktail sauce and the star of the
show extra hot horseradish get some
fresh stuff that stuff in the back of
your fridge from the clinton
administration it's just not going to be
strong enough so get some horseradish
some chili sauce made by the same
company that makes the ketchup some
ketchup some hot sauce a little bit of
lemon juice a little bit of salt and
Worcestershire sauce so I use a very
classic cocktail mix that I've perfected
over the years and I actually think it's
just my mom's recipe but anyway really
delicious refrigerate that before
serving okay so our poaching liquids
ready our cocktail sauce is ready and
now we're going to poach our shrimp
colossal jumbo shrimp
those are like 12 15 to a pound this
comes what's called easy peel or ready
to peel which means they're already
split down the back and you really want
to do your shrimp cocktail with shrimp
that has the shell on lots of extra
flavor if yours don't come already split
just take a pair of scissors cut down
the back and use a paring knife to take
out the vein the intestinal tract there
and you'll have the same thing all right
so we're ready to poach our shrimp our
poaching liquid our bullion
is boiling I have a bowl of ice water
right next to it with a strainer I'm
going to throw in my shrimp I'm gonna
make sure the poaching liquid is boiling
rapidly I'm going to throw it in there
for five minutes of course that is a
guide all right some people say when it
returns back to a boil they're done I
you know I don't know about that so I'm
gonna go five minutes here you know when
your shrimps cooked right it turns from
translucent to pink and they get kind of
firm soon as they're done I'm going to
fish them out right into the ice water
you want to chill these down you don't
want them to keep cooking once those are
cold you can drain them and you're ready
to serve now I am a big firm believer in
peel your own shrimp cocktail they say
there's a thin layer of fat between the
shell and the shrimp it gives you some
nice flavor so I think the superior
shrimp cocktail is peeled fresh if you
want to spoil your guests and peel it
for them make sure you leave the little
tail on you know for appearance's so if
it's me I'm just throwing out a bowl of
shrimp like that cocktail sauce lemon
next to it if you want to get all fancy
you can put them on a platter if you
want to get really fancy of course you
can peel them all for your guests and
put them in little cocktail glasses with
some crackers and you know do it like
they do downtown and there's just
nothing like that sweet freshly poached
cold shrimp dipped in that spicy
horseradish a tangy cocktail sauce just
classic classic combination go to the
site get all the ingredients and as
always enjoy
you
